remarks: If an eventually bounded function is bounded on every interval ` A i^i ( -oo , y ) ` by a function ` M ( y ) ` , then the function is bounded on the whole domain.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Apr-2016.)
statement:
lo1bdd2.1 $e |- ( ph -> A C_ RR ) $.
lo1bdd2.2 $e |- ( ph -> C e. RR ) $.
lo1bdd2.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. A ) -> B e. RR ) $.
lo1bdd2.4 $e |- ( ph -> ( x e. A |-> B ) e. <_O(1) ) $.
lo1bdd2.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( y e. RR /\ C <_ y ) ) -> M e. RR ) $.
lo1bdd2.6 $e |- ( ( ( ph /\ x e. A ) /\ ( ( y e. RR /\ C <_ y ) /\ x < y ) ) -> B <_ M ) $.
lo1bdd2 $p |- ( ph -> E. m e. RR A. x e. A B <_ m ) $.

$d B m y $.
$d C x y $.
$d M m x $.
$d ph x y $.
